titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Magie Dominic Off Off-Broadway Collection, 1952-2019 MSS.300
titlestmt.author: Robin Preiss, with Nicholas Martin, 2013.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-04-03 13:32:44 UTC.

change.item: Updated to include materials integrated from accession number 2018.124 by Stacey Flatt.
Updated by Rachel Searcy to reflect 2023 accretion
Updated by Anna Bj√∂rnsson McCormick to reflect the rehousing of access copies

physdesc.extent: in 7 binders, 3 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box, 1 oversize box, 2 flat-file folders, and 1 folder in shared housing

did.abstract: Magie Dominic, an artist, poet, and founding member of the Off Off-Broadway theater movement, was born in Newfoundland in 1944, and resides primarily in New York. She founded and programmed the Children's History Theatre (1979-84), and was an active participant at Caffe Cino. The collection comprises materials created and compiled by Magie Dominic in the course of her involvement with the Off-Off Broadway theatre movement, especially Caffe Cino, as well as her own work as an artist and her work with the Children's History Theater. It includes clippings, photographic material, manuscripts, correspondence, and art and performance documentation.
did.physloc: Some materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Magie Dominic Off-Off Broadway Collection was donated to Fales Library by Magie Dominic in October 2010 and January 2011. Accretion were donated by Magie Dominic and James Gossage in September 2018 and August 2022. The accession number associated with these gift are 2018.124 and 2023.012.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series, folder and binder titles reflect Magie Dominic's original titles and arrangement. Small changes were made to facilitate access. Dominic's original order has been maintained; oversize and media items were removed from and placed in appropriate archival housing in separate series.
The collection is arranged into seven series:
Series V: The Children's History Theatre

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p:
Magie Dominic, an artist, poet, and founding member of the Off Off-Broadway theater movement, was born in Newfoundland in 1944, and resides primarily in New York. She founded and programmed the Children's History Theatre (1979-84), and was an active participant at Caffe Cino.
Source:
Dominic, Magie. "Dominic Magie L." Poets.ca. The League of Canadian Poets, 19 Apr. 2011. Web. 6 May 2013, poets.ca.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Access copies for some materials are available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Magie Dominic Off-Off-Broadway Collection; MSS 300; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection comprises materials created and compiled by Magie Dominic in the course of her involvement with the Off-Off Broadway theatre movement, especially Caffe Cino, as well as her own work as an artist and her work with the Children's History Theater. It includes clippings, photographic material, manuscripts, correspondence, and art and performance documentation.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing decisions made prior to 2018 are not documented. Materials in the 2018 accretion were integrated into Series I. in accordance with the collection's existing arrangement structure, and placed in new acid-free folders and box. All photographs and printouts were removed from their individual plastic sleeves. Negatives were placed in enclosures. On April 2019 materials from Box 5 were redistributed mostly into a smaller, letter-sized manuscript box, labeled Box 5. Oversize materials were moved to Shared Fales 019. In February 2023 an accretion was intellectually integrated into Series I in Shared Fales 041.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional material can be found in the following archival collections:
New York Public Library Archives and Manuscripts, James Gossage photographs: http://archives.nypl.org/the/21426

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series I: Caffe Cino includes two binders of documentary files, including clippings and photographic material, as well as posters, related to Caffe Cino.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series II: Lost to AIDS includes two binders of subject files compiled by Dominic related to friends and collaborators who died of AIDS, as well as documentation of the AIDS Memorial Quilt.

container.altrender: Box Binder (2" wide, any dimensions between 12x16)
container.label: Mixed Materials [31142063614443]

odd.p: Hibiscus, Eddie Bhartonn, Neil Flanagan, Seth Allen, Bill Haislip, Peter Hujar, Charles Ludlam, and Peter Hartman.

container.altrender: Box Binder (2" wide, any dimensions between 12x16)
container.label: Mixed Materials [31142063614450]

odd.head: Subjects include:
odd.p: Charles Lubier, Ken Burgess, Ken Hill, Tom Eyen, Johnny Dodd, Andy Milligan, and Victor LiPari.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series III: Ken Burgess includes several coloring books designed by Burgess, as well as a binder of materials related to Burgess's work, compiled by Magie Dominic.

container.label: Mixed Materials [31142063614468]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series IV: Magie Dominic Art contains materials related to Magie Dominic's artistic output, including manuscripts, correspondence, and clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series V: The Children's History Theatre documents the Children's History Theatre, which Magie Dominic founded and directed. Materials include correspondence, photographic material, clippings, and performance documentation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series VI: Media features audio and video materials from the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accretion consists of programs, scripts, photographs, and ephemera documenting activities related to Caffe Cino. The production Dames at Sea is particularly well documented. The accretion also includes materials documenting Dominic's independent artwork and poetry, as well as her involvement with the Children's History Theatre.
